metadata.Title: CVE-2023-21264 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - high
metadata.Description:
In multiple functions of mem_protect.c, there is a possible way to accesshypervisor memory due to a memory access check in the wrong place. Thiscould lead to local escalation of privilege with System executionprivileges needed. User interaction is not needed for exploitation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-21264` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-5.13.0-19-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-generic-64k - 5.13.0-19.19
linux-image-unsigned-5.13.0-19-lowlatency - 5.13.0-19.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.13.0-19.19').
